intro: Myrsine guineensis, commonly known as African myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly West Africa. The plant features elliptic to ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, red berries that are edible. Myrsine guineensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
